result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie J. Boen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Katie J. Boen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Katie J. Boen was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:38 pm Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf168, 16cf79, 15cf241 and 15cf29. Schiek statement. Has complied with victim rights legislation. Kohn statement on sentencing. Defendant statement. Court questions defendant regarding signing releases previously ordered to be signed. Defendant states that prior Public Defender filed with Court. Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
15cf168, 16cf79 and 15cf241 - CC
Jail - 6 months with Huber. To commence on/before December 28, 2016 at 08:30 a.m. 
Court finds medically necessary that defendant receive mental health treatment at jail.
Court remits costs.
Appeal rights given. 
Adj. 2:47 p.m.
change of telephone number

10:21 a.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf168, 16cf79, 16cf85, 16cm225, 15cf29. Pfeifer states agreement.
In 16cf79 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 2 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 3 to misdemeanor bail jumping - Granted.
16cf85 - State moves to dismiss in its entirety - Granted.
16cm225 - State moves to dismiss in its entirety - Granted.
16cf168 - State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 2 to misdemeanor bail jumping.
15cf241 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 2 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 3 to misdemeanor bail jumping. 
  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Off record for scheduling. 10:33 a.m. - Sentencing hearing scheduled. Bail continued. Adj. 10:33 a.m. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:13 p.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf29, 16cf85, 15cf168, 16cf79, 15cf241 and 16cm225. Schiek statement - no global resolution - will proceed to sentencing today in 15cf29. Burns statement that she believes resolution is close - defendant needs a little more time to consider agreement in other matters. Schiek statement on sentencing - Exhibits 1 and 2 marked (letters). G.B., victim's aunt, statement on sentencing. G.F., victim's grandmother, statement on sentencing. Burns statement on sentencing  - Defense Exhibits 3 and 4 (letters) marked. Court statement on sentencing. Defendant statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP-3 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 60 days with Huber for all purposes. Will allow release for child visitation purposes. Remand immediately.
Psychological examination and treatment if done not in last year - if performed in last year - Oneida County Social Services/Corp Counsel to share results with probation agent
AODA assessment and treatment
Random drug/alcohol testing
Comply with all other agencies' orders
Sign all necessary releases to allow information to be shared/released
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given. 

All other cases  - next hearing date is August 2, 2016 at 3:00 p.m.
In 16cm225 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Court sets $500 signature bond. Next hearing - August 2, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. 
Bail continued in other matters. 
Adj. 4:02 p.m.

1:29 p.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf29, 16cf79, 15cf241, 16cf85, 15cf168. Attorney Mary Burns is present in Court. Burns statement that she will be representing on 16cf79 and 16cf85. Schiek/Rielly statement - ready to proceed to sentencing - Rielly files character statement for sentencing. Defendant statement that she does not want to proceed to sentencing today - would like Attorney Burns to have time to review as all the cases are connected. Schiek statement to proceed today on sentencing; can then work on global resolution of other cases; if sentencing does not proceed today - would possibly want a PSI. Rielly moves to withdraw from 15cf29, 15cf241 and 15cf168 - Granted. Court to allow Burns to investigate whether she is eligible to represent in all cases. Court does not require PSI. Court will not allow an additional adjournment on sentencing. 1:40 p.m. Off record for scheduling. 1:42 p.m. Pre-trial conference on June 7, 2016 on all matters except 15CF29- if matters are resolved - sentencing on that date on all matters.  Parties stipulate that Court will be provided with copies of Social Services records. Rights to preliminary hearings are not waived - if matters are not resolved - on June 7, 2016 preliminary hearings will be scheduled. Court advises defendant that sentencing will proceed on June 7, 2016 with or without an attorney present - if defendant does not want Attorney Burns to represent - will still proceed to sentencing. Defendant requests bond condition in 16cf79 of no scheduled visitation with child of Mr. Marshall to be removed - Attorney Fugel present in court - no CHIPS case regarding child of Marshall/Boen - there is a family case scheduled for hearing next week - Court modifies bond condition removing scheduled visitation with minor child  and adds must comply with all family court orders.  Attorney Fugel/Court discussion on documentation to be provided to Court - copies of all documents to be submitted to Court shoud be provided to Attorney Burns. Adj. 1:50 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduled w/15CF29
Following 15CF29
Tracking with 15cf29

Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15cf168 and 15cf241 will be set for status- Schiek statement - request child witness interview  be provided to court  - Will file proper motion - 
Bail continued on all cases  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:22 p.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to proceed on own - Waiver free and voluntary - Defendant pleads not guilty - Bail continued  Status conference scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No contact with Debra L. Smith
